meanings.definition: A feudal tenant entirely subject to a lord or manor.
meanings.sent1: The villeins worked hard on the lord's land.
meanings.sent2: The lord expected the villeins to obey his every command.
meanings.sent3: The villeins decided to play a prank on the lord by planting carrots in his flower bed.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the lord and the villeins was like that of a king and his loyal subjects.
meanings.sent5: The villeins' lives revolved around serving the lord and working the fields.

meanings.definition: A person who is in a condition of servitude, required to work on the lord's land and give him homage.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, villeins had to toil on the lord's estate.
meanings.sent2: The villeins showed respect to the lord by paying homage.
meanings.sent3: One of the villeins accidentally spilled water on the lord's shoes, causing a humorous situation.
meanings.sent4: The villeins' loyalty to the lord was as strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The image of the villeins laboring in the fields under the hot sun was etched in everyone's minds.
